# Phone Swap Request Feature

## Requirements
Date: October 14, 2025  
Attendees: Product Manager, UX Designer, Lead Frontend Developer, Lead Backend Developer

### Objective
Define the requirements and implementation plan for the new phone swap request feature.

## Background
Users currently lack a formal way to request an exchange of their current phone for another one available in our inventory. This new feature aims to create a streamlined, in-app workflow to manage these requests efficiently.

### Feature Overview
The team agreed on the following user story: "As a user, I want to request a phone from the available list and offer one of my current phones in exchange, so I can easily manage my device swaps." The feature will be implemented as a modal pop-up on the main phone list page.

## Implementation Details
### Frontend  (UI/UX)
A new button, labeled "Request Phone Swap", will be added to the main phone page. Clicking this button will trigger a modal (pop-up) that overlays the current view. The modal will contain a form with the following fields:
   - Phone to Request: A dropdown list populated with all available phones from the main list.
   - Phone to Exchange: A dropdown list showing only the phones currently owned by the logged-in user.
   - Reason for Request (Optional): A text area for any additional comments.
Actions: "Submit Request" and "Cancel" buttons. Upon successful submission, the modal will close, and a confirmation message will be displayed.

### Backend  (Logic)
A new API endpoint (POST /api/phone-swaps) will be created to handle form submissions. A new table will be created in the database to store swap requests. It will include columns for the requester's ID, the requested phone, the offered phone, a status (defaulting to 'Pending'), and the comment. Backend validation will ensure that the user making the request is the actual owner of the phone being offered in exchange.

## Action Items
- UX Team: Create a wireframe of the modal and form by EOD, October 17.
- Backend Team: Develop the new API endpoint and database schema. Target completion: October 21.
- Frontend Team: Build the "Request Phone Swap" button and the basic modal structure. Begin implementation once wireframes are approved.
- Product Manager: Create the formal Jira ticket with the defined user story and acceptance criteria.

## Project Context (from codebase)
### Key Project Entities (Most Important) 
   - UserDto  (class)
   - WeatherForecast  (class)
   - UsersController  (class)
   - WeatherForecastController  (class)
   - IUserService  (class)
   - UserService  (class)
   - IMongoDBSettings  (class)
   - MongoDBSettings  (class)
   - AppRoutingModule  (class)
   - AppComponent  (class)
   - AppModule  (class)
   - AuthenticationModule  (class)
   - LoginComponent  (class)
   - RegisterComponent  (class)
   - NameUppercasePipe  (class)

### Codebase Context (High Relevance)
Snippet 1-3: Handles user authentication and registration. UserDto is used to store user data, while UsersController handles HTTP requests related to users. Snippet 4-5: Implements a table for displaying phone information. The PhoneService class manages the phones.

    artifact_type_normalized = artifact_type.lower().replace("-", "_").replace(" ", "_")
    
    # Iterate through all artifact_ids in the version service
    matching_artifact_ids = []

        # Check if this artifact_id matches the type (starts with artifact_type)

validation_score: float = 0.0
    artifact_type: str = ""
    model_used: str = ""
    reward_signal: float = 0.0
    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)

    def to_training_example(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Convert the event into a generic fine-tuning example payload."""
        target = self.corrected_output if self.corrected_output else self.ai_output
        return {
            "instruction": f"Generate {self.artifact_type}",
            "input": self.input_data,
            "output": target,
            "context": json.dumps(self.context),
            "quality_score": self.validation_score,
        }


@dataclass
class TrainingBatch:
    """Bundle of curated training examples ready for downstream fine-tuning."""

    batch_id: str
    created_at: float
    examples: List[Dict[str, Any]]
    priority: int
    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
    hyperparameters: Optional[Any] = None

# FinalProject

This project was generated with [Angular CLI](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli) version 15.2.4.

## Development server

Run `ng serve` for a dev server. Navigate to `http://localhost:4200/`. The application will automatically reload if you change any of the source files.

## Code scaffolding

Run `ng generate component component-name` to generate a new component. You can also use `ng generate directive|pipe|service|class|guard|interface|enum|module`.

## Build

Run `ng build` to build the project. The build artifacts will be stored in the `dist/` directory.

## Running unit tests

Run `ng test` to execute the unit tests via [Karma](https://karma-runner.github.io).

## Running end-to-end tests

Run `ng e2e` to execute the end-to-end tests via a platform of your choice. To use this command, you need to first add a package that implements end-to-end testing capabilities.

## Further help

## Requirements
Date: October 14, 2025  
Attendees: Product Manager, UX Designer, Lead Frontend Developer, Lead Backend Developer

### Objective
Define the requirements and implementation plan for the new phone swap request feature.

## Background
Users currently lack a formal way to request an exchange of their current phone for another one available in our inventory. This new feature aims to create a streamlined, in-app workflow to manage these requests efficiently.

### Feature Overview
The team agreed on the following user story: "As a user, I want to request a phone from the available list and offer one of my current phones in exchange, so I can easily manage my device swaps." The feature will be implemented as a modal pop-up on the main phone list page.

content:
## API Documentation

This document provides an overview of the RESTful API provided by this application. 

### Endpoints

#### Authentication

- `POST /api/auth/login` - Logs in a user with email and password.
- `POST /api/auth/register` - Registers a new user with email, password, firstName, and lastName.

#### Phones

- `GET /api/phones` - Retrieves all phones.
- `POST /api/phones` - Adds a new phone. Requires brand, model, storage, and price in the request body.
- `PUT /api/phones/{id}` - Updates an existing phone with id. Replace {id} with the actual phone's id. Requires brand, model, storage, and price in the request body.
- `DELETE /api/phones/{id}` - Deletes a phone with id. Replace {id} with the actual phone's id.

### Error Codes

- 401 Unauthorized: Returned when the provided credentials are incorrect or missing.
- 403 Forbidden: Returned when the user does not have permission to perform the action.
- 404 Not Found: Returned when a resource is not found.
- 500 Internal Server Error: Returned on any unhandled server error.

### Examples

#### Login

Request:
```bash
curl -X POST \
  http://localhost:3000/api/auth/login \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "password": "password"
}'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "token": "jwt_token"
}
```

#### Register

Request:
```bash
curl -X POST \
  http://localhost:3000/api/auth/register \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "password": "password",
    "firstName": "John",
    "lastName": "Doe"
}'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "message": "User registered successfully"
}
```

#### Get Phones

Request:
```bash
curl -X GET \
  http://localhost:3000/api/phones \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer jwt_token'
```
Response:
```json
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "brand": "Apple",
    "model": "iPhone 12",
    "storage": 64,
    "price": 799
  },
  ...
]
```

#### Add Phone

Request:
```bash
curl -X POST \
  http://localhost:3000/api/phones \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer jwt_token' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "brand": "Samsung",
    "model": "Galaxy S21",
    "storage": 128,
    "price": 699
}'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "message": "Phone added successfully"
}
```

#### Update Phone

Request:
```bash
curl -X PUT \
  http://localhost:3000/api/phones/1 \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer jwt_token' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "brand": "Samsung",
    "model": "Galaxy S21",
    "storage": 128,
    "price": 699
}'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "message": "Phone updated successfully"
}
```

#### Delete Phone

Request:
```bash
curl -X DELETE \
  http://localhost:3000/api/phones/1 \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer jwt_token'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "message": "Phone deleted successfully"
}
```

# FinalProject

This project was generated with [Angular CLI](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli) version 15.2.4.

## Development server

Run `ng serve` for a dev server. Navigate to `http://localhost:4200/`. The application will automatically reload if you change any of the source files.

## Code scaffolding

Run `ng generate component component-name` to generate a new component. You can also use `ng generate directive|pipe|service|class|guard|interface|enum|module`.

## Build

Run `ng build` to build the project. The build artifacts will be stored in the `dist/` directory.

## Running unit tests

Run `ng test` to execute the unit tests via [Karma](https://karma-runner.github.io).

## Running end-to-end tests

Run `ng e2e` to execute the end-to-end tests via a platform of your choice. To use this command, you need to first add a package that implements end-to-end testing capabilities.

## Further help

To get more help on the Angular CLI use `ng help` or go check out the [Angular CLI Overview and Command Reference](https://angular.io/cli) page.

content:
## API Documentation

This document provides an overview of the RESTful APIs provided by this application. The documentation includes endpoints, methods, request/response schemas, examples, and error codes. 

Please note that all responses are in JSON format.

### Endpoint: /login

#### POST

Login to the system with email and password.

Request Body:
```json
{
    "email": "string",
    "password": "string"
}
```
Response:
Successful login returns a token in JSON format.
```json
{
    "token": "string"
}
```
Error Codes: 401 - Unauthorized (Invalid email or password)

### Endpoint: /register

#### POST

Register a new user with email, password and name.

Request Body:
```json
{
    "email": "string",
    "password": "string",
    "firstName": "string",
    "lastName": "string"
}
```
Response: 
Successful registration returns a message in JSON format.
```json
{
    "message": "string"
}
```
Error Codes: 409 - Conflict (Email already registered)

### Endpoint: /phones

#### GET

Get all phones from the system.

Response:
Returns an array of phone objects in JSON format.
```json
[
    {
        "id": "number",
        "brand": "string",
        "model": "string",
        "storage": "number",
        "price": "number"
    }
]
```
Error Codes: 500 - Internal Server Error (Failed to retrieve phones)

#### POST

Add a new phone to the system. Requires admin role.

Request Body:
```json
{
    "brand": "string",
    "model": "string",
    "storage": "number",
    "price": "number"
}
```
Response: 
Returns the created phone object in JSON format.
```json
{
    "id": "number",
    "brand": "string",
    "model": "string",
    "storage": "number",
    "price": "number"
}
```
Error Codes: 401 - Unauthorized (Unauthorized user), 403 - Forbidden (User does not have admin role)

#### PUT

Update an existing phone in the system. Requires admin role.

Request Body:
```json
{
    "id": "number",
    "brand": "string",
    "model": "string",
    "storage": "number",
    "price": "number"
}
```
Response: 
Returns the updated phone object in JSON format.
```json
{
    "id": "number",
    "brand": "string",
    "model": "string",
    "storage": "number",
    "price": "number"
}
```
Error Codes: 401 - Unauthorized (Unauthorized user), 403 - Forbidden (User does not have admin role), 404 - Not Found (Phone not found)

#### DELETE

Delete a phone from the system. Requires admin role.

Request Body: None

Response: 
Returns a message in JSON format indicating successful deletion.
```json
{
    "message": "string"
}
```
Error Codes: 401 - Unauthorized (Unauthorized user), 403 - Forbidden (User does not have admin role), 404 - Not Found (Phone not found)

  "compileOnSave": false,
  "compilerOptions": {
    "baseUrl": "./",
    "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
    "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
    "strict": true,

  }
}

# FinalProject

This project was generated with [Angular CLI](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli) version 15.2.4.

## Development server

Run `ng serve` for a dev server. Navigate to `http://localhost:4200/`. The application will automatically reload if you change any of the source files.

## Code scaffolding

Run `ng generate component component-name` to generate a new component. You can also use `ng generate directive|pipe|service|class|guard|interface|enum|module`.

## Build

Run `ng build` to build the project. The build artifacts will be stored in the `dist/` directory.

## Running unit tests

Run `ng test` to execute the unit tests via [Karma](https://karma-runner.github.io).

## Running end-to-end tests

Run `ng e2e` to execute the end-to-end tests via a platform of your choice. To use this command, you need to first add a package that implements end-to-end testing capabilities.

## Further help

To get more help on the Angular CLI use `ng help` or go check out the [Angular CLI Overview and Command Reference](https://angular.io/cli) page.
